Reviews.Title: “Take the train!”
Reviews.Author: Peter D
Reviews.Content: Living in Spain means loads of places to go visit, this time I decided to take the AVE fast train from Malaga, if you have not traveled on the AVE it's a must do trip. The hotel is at the top of a steep climb, ok going down but if you have luggage or after a day sight seeing it's a bit daunting! I found the bus stop just a few yards from McDs very handy 3 buses stop almost outside the hotel. I can agree with most comments here, but as we normally only use hotels as a base I found it ok, my room was clean and comfortable, and breakfast sellection was more than adequate. But if you really want to get the most out of your trip I would suggest using the city tours bus it stops outside McDs and you get to see a lot more than just walking around

Reviews.Title: “Like it a lot”
Reviews.Author: waltinho
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Tryp Atocha on two occasions and both times have been very happy with their service and the accommodations. It is the perfect location to get to the Atocha train station and the Plaza Mayor. It also has a metro stop right in front of it which is very convenient for travel to other parts of the city if desired.

Reviews.Title: “Catalonia Atocha Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gerald S
Reviews.Content: Although located on a slightly scruffy street, this hotel has many advantages.It is within short walking distance of the railway station or a short 2-euro taxi trip (but an 8 euro minimum applies in the city centre). It is also within easy walking to El Prado and Thyssen museums and the Royal Botanical Garden. If instead of turning right on Calle Huertas in the direction of these destinations one turns to the left, the delightful alfresco dining of Plaza de Santa Ana is avalable. On the way to this plaza one passes Casa Alberto, a good-value restaurant. I was impressed by the interior design and decoration of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible services”
Reviews.Author: Carolina B
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel in our tour to Europe and we thought it was right because it was walking distance to several important places; luckily it was only for one night because the air conditioning did not work and it was 35°C. The next day the elevator did not work as well and we were placed in a room in the annex building in the third floor, so we had to carry our luggage down for three floors, finally they had a problem with cable T.V. in all the rooms, so we couldn't watch any TV . When we complained they told us they were taking care of it as we spoke but next day everything was still the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: LuckyCharm2012
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel during a spur-of-the-moment trip to Madrid during the 2nd week in July, our first time in that beautiful city. No hotel shuttle but it was easy to get to from the airport: we opted to jump on the Airport Express bus from Barajas and got off at the last stop - the Atocha Train station. Its about a 40 minute trip @ 3 euro per person, the bus even has free wi-fi. From the train station its about a 5-10 minute walk to the hotel. (If you plan to take the bus back to the airport, just make sure you can grab it again at the train station because it doesn't operate out of there during certain hours.) During your walk, as you get closer to hotel you might see a few "interesting" shops... but that just adds to the character, we encountered no problems whatsoever and there were people, families, etc. walking around everywhere. My husband even had his hair cut at one of the clean, friendly shops down the street and they did a great job. We had a room with a King bed with all your basic necessities. It was clean and modern and on the small side (no dresser) but we never spend much time in our room anyway. They have a nicely stocked fridge, flat screen TV, nice bathroom with a bidet. The few problems we encountered were taken care of right away: no working air conditioning, broken toilet seat. The safe was also out of order but we had no need for it. The staff were all very friendly and polite and eager to help. There was a security guard at all times in the lobby so safety was never an issue. He even locked our bags in a private room when we arrived early in the morning our first day (our room was not ready) so we didn't have to worry about our belongings while we explored the city, went for breakfast. The location is excellent! You have the Metro Station (Anton Martin stop) at your front door that will take you basically anywhere you want to go. The stations are clean and user friendly, ticket kiosks are set up for several languages and there are signs everywhere indicating station line numbers and stops, all color coordinated. We walked to Retiro Park and Museo del Prado just around the corner. We went to Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol and San Miguel Market, all about 15-20 minutes away, on foot...but you can easily get there on the Metro as well. We also hopped on the Madrid Tourist bus which has a stop right around the corner, on the main street next to McDonald’s. In all honesty we weren’t expecting much… but were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel and staff, and would stay here again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Leyda M
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive quality hotel in Madrid for one night. I had been busy all week and didnt have time to do much research, I saw a daily deal for the Atocha Hotel, so I decided to book it..The hotel was so easy to get to, the train station was right in front of the hotel. I checked in, the staff was extremely nice, got my room It was very nice, very clean, flat screen TV, very clean and modern bathroom. I even got a balcony! The location was Perfect! You could walk to Every important and fun place, Puerta del Sol, plaza Santa Ana, San Miguel Market etc...just perfectly located, I didnt have to spend money for train rides...when I left the next morning I walked down the hill to the Main Atocha station and decided to take the airport bus which leaves every 15min. It was so easy! I definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Hillburyboy
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel, centrally located. Premium Rooms are comfortable and with a nicely appointed bathroom. There are plenty of interesting bars in the nearby narrow streets (and some very seedy places on the main Calle Atocha nearby).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: EllieA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my husband on a short break. The staff were all very friendly, happy to give directions to all sights. Breakfast was great. Room was very comfortable but would advise asking for a room at the back of the building. The street to the front is a main road and stayed noisey till 4am!

Reviews.Title: “I love Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: livlovlaf8
Reviews.Content: The Tryp Atocha Hotel is a very nice and centralized place to stay in Madrid. We were there during Semana Santa and walked to the Plaza Mayor, Mercado San Miguel, el Palacio Real - todas partes. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. The room had a small, lovely balcony. As an added (wonderful!) surprise, a procession passed by on the street corner, just below our room, our first night there and we could see EVERYTHING from our balcony! ¡Qué perfecto! I can hardly wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A bit old, a bit tired, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jack H
Reviews.Content: Its ok - clean, friendly, good breakfast, brilliant location But it's not great - terrible Internet and basically useless WIFI, rooms very small and strangely shaped, and it's just a bit old and tired

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location ...”
Reviews.Author: Someone_from_Berlin
Reviews.Content: ... but that would be the main attraction of the hotel. We had a "premium" room with a view into the tiny, inner courtyard, very quiet - most of the time, no problem to find sleep and to sleep long. The room looks much spacier on the hotel's web-site. If you come as tourist, do not pay extra for the premium class - it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Prozach
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Madrid in mid-march, three adults in two rooms for four nights. We booked the hotel through priceline, name your own price. We got a decent deal, so overall the value we got was reasonable. Having said that, there were a couple of things we disliked and a few that we liked. The location is quite central. It is close to all three museums (Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia), and walking distance from the Plaza Mayor, Puerta Del Sol, Gran Via, The royal Palace. The metro station is a short walk away. But, a central location applies to almost any hotel in the Sol area. The neighborhood, on the other hand, is not as nice as in the Gran Via. I was Ok with it, but it is much nicer to get out of the hotel in the morning to the view of the Metropolis building, than it is to the bustle of Calle De Atocha. The checkin process was rather slow. We got in at 11pm and there were several people in front of us. On a few occasions during our stay, we had to wait a long time for the receptionists. It seems that the desk is understaffed quite frequently. The hotel does not have wi-fi in the lobby (poor reception). Wi-fi gets stronger as you walk to the back end of the hotel, where the rooms are. If your room is around that area, you could get wi-fi in the room, although the reception may be choppy. In room 219, I had good reception but your mileage may vary. At this day and age, I would expect in-room wi-fi. My guess is that in higher floors, reception will be lousy. There is a wired connection in the room, which was OK but we had to get a cable from the front desk. My room was actually good. The best part was the bathroom, which was quite spacious and recently renovated. One issue is that there were a few exposed nails in the woodwork and I actually stepped on one in the middle of the night. Not fun and this should not happen. Towels were old and thin. My friends stayed in 121 on the first floor. They had a worse experience, with the street noise often becoming quite loud, especially on weekends. Try to avoid the first floor. Breakfast was decent but not worth it. We had it only once, as we preferred to pay to one of the local breakfast spots in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Near city center, big bedrooms for families”
Reviews.Author: AnaPorto
Reviews.Content: This hotel has something that I never found in other hotels, a city hotel with big bedrooms for families. If you have family go this hotel that you never will be put it on a small bedroom. The breakfeast it is ok. The city center its is at 10 minutes walking.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Busby W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in dire need of an upgrade they say they have wifi and dont. The safes dont work, the roms are tiny, the front desk lacks co sideration and friendliness. The hotel manager was nice but thats about it

Reviews.Title: “Horrible costumer service, no WIFI and cheap excuses for everything”
Reviews.Author: Carla J
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location but that's all about it. I arrived in Madrid in from Houston, TX after 12 hours flying and feeling sick. They didnt allow me to get my room at 9 AM, They made me wait in the freezing hotel lobby for 2 hrs, I was half asleep and very weak and nobody checked on my, I have to drag myself again to the check in desk, what was my surprise! I realized they were checking in people in front of my eyes and they still denied me my room. I have to complain and complain and finally the rude, unprofessional and cold front desk (Ms. Eva) gave me the key to my room. She was insisting the check in time was 11 AM, ok, lady! what about being little bit human and give a sick person a room to rest!!! Too snob to work in a front desk! Room service was slow and bad, no food menu in the room, no variety of drinks in the fridge... super annoying hot in the rooms, nobody help you out with your luggages ! ! I complained with the person in charge in the front desk and he assured me they will be sending me an email and after a week, I'm still waiting on a that... No WIFI, they'll give you a wire to connect to internet and they charge you a lot for that...simply unacceptable in a 4 stars hotel! To sum up a MESS and not a true 4 stars hotel at all!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Avoid it if you can!

Reviews.Title: “What a nice tryp!”
Reviews.Author: starfirebhs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Madrid Tryp Atocha twice at the beginning and end of my travel to Morocco. The location is very good and easy to get to from the airport, despite the multiple Metro changes. Be sure to get off at Anton Martin. I did get turned around but was able to correct on my own. Madrid is very expensive. From theTryp Atocha I was able to take the subway to Gran Via and shop at the supermarket El Cortes Ingles. I also ate breakfast at the Duncan Doughtnut near the hotel one day. The second time, I participated in the breafast buffet. It consisted of soggy eggs, a toast machine, various juices - apple, mango, orange, many breads, tea, coffee, milk, soy milk, smoked salmon, jams, honey, olive oil, Spanish hard sausage (fatty), pork sausages, cereals, many delicious looking cheeses, fresh pineapple and more. While it is nice to have a tv in the room to aid in sleeping (for me), I did NOT like the sole English channel. The Tryp needs to update to include an English speaking movie channel esp since they have satellite and English visitors. That is unacceptable despite just using the room as a stopover. The tub with shower is a bit high and may be difficult for some to enter. The towels are huge and clean but u should bring ur own wash cloth. The provide basic stuff like a toothbrush/paste, comb, shaving kit and shower cap. The shower cap is too small or maybe my head is too big!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: maya_BG
Reviews.Content: I spend a weekend in this hotel and i would like to recommed it to everybody who search an excellent location in the heart of Madird on a reasonable price. I loved my room, it was a fitness equipment inside ... :) Was quite which is very important. Additionally, the staff was very friendly, especially on the reception. The variety of the breakfast also was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but small room.”
Reviews.Author: RogerdB
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location near the Atoacha trainstation and metro stop (Anton Martin) that is the only pro of the hotel. I stayed in the luxury room on the backside of the hotel on I believe the 5th floor (with a nice view over Madrid). The room was ok, but basic and very small! Especially the bathroom was to small for a hotel of this class and not very comfortable. The breakfast was good of qualtiy and has a good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Maze”
Reviews.Author: CUBBEAR07
Reviews.Content: I felt like a mouse in a maze. Endless corridors.. I took forever to find our room. When we arrived we discovered that we cannot close the window. Street were narrow at the back street so we can easily here the neighbors. But hotel was clean and in a good location. We walked to many places from the hotel. Museums, park, train station, that famous square and the shops. If the hotel is in a good and historic old town like that I do not expect to much from it. And this was a small good hotel in old town.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frédéric B
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to say about this hotel. Rooms are very clean, decoration is simple, location is convenient to see the major sights but close to the seedy parts of Madrid. Of note: the breakfast buffet is huge and of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, professional and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Tryp Atocha is really close to Puerta del Sol and Parque Buen del Retiro, so really the whole city is less than 20 mins walk away - if you know where you are going :) If you don't fancy walking then the tube (metro) station is right outside the door. Breakfasts were good, bed was comfy, air conditioning worked a treat. The only thing I would improve is make the windows a little bigger to let more light in but to be honest I didn't spend much time in the room and, for what I paid, the place was a bargain. Also there was no Wi-fi - which actually was bliss, but if you need to be connected all the time you'll be relying on your phone coverage.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend this hotel for Business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Bryanthegirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was noisy, with large groups of teenagers and guests making noise in the stairways/corridors at night. The room was hot and the room window was locked so you couldn't cool it down. There was no independent air conditioning (I presume that there is centrally controlled air conditioning but it was not turned on). There was no restaurant in the hotel so I was advised to go to a restaurant opposite the hotel. The only positive was the location, but I wouldn't stay here again or recommend it to business travellers. Probably good fun if you're a young thing!

Reviews.Title: “OK Location but Horrid Room”
Reviews.Author: loobyloo2000
Reviews.Content: My trip to Madrid is coloured by having my purse pickpocketed within an hour of arriving at the airport but I'll try and be objective about the hotel. Our room (309) had no view other than the inner well. When we arrived the window was open and it stank of drains. I closed the window and turned up the aircon which was next to useless. If I hadn't just had my purse nicked I would have demanded a different room but to be honest the holiday was already ruined. The breakfast was mediocre - coffee in the pot was stone cold. Instead people queued for the coffee out of the coffee machine which was much better apart from having to queue for it! The hotel was well located for the metro if you could trust the metro having just had your purse stolen on it...

Reviews.Title: “Centric but in a noisy location”
Reviews.Author: pelotilla
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is perfectly ok for a weekend in Madrid. The building is old but it has been renovated and the rooms are very clean. It is located in a very noisy street. I would recommend booking an interior room if you stay here. There are bus and metro stops directly at the door and the Plaza Mayor and Sol are easily reachable by foot. However, this is not one of the most beautiful areas of the city. I would recommend to stay near Opera or the Paseo the Recoletos for you visit to Madrid. As an independent traveler, you should know that this hotel is usually fully booked by tour operators. It is usual to meet large groups that pack the breakfast or reception rooms at certain hours. Breakfast and service were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: triptaker0508
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights, and the hotel definitely met our needs. We booked through Priceline, so we weren't sure exactly what it would be like. The location was great, with the metro station right outside and plenty of places within walking distance. The room was clean and quiet. The front desk staff was very helpful answering all our questions as well. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, nice location”
Reviews.Author: olasBH
Reviews.Content: The location is excelent, close to Prado Museum, plaza del Sol, everything in a walk distance. The service was very good, helpful staff, confotble rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - a smart choise for central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: maoodi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 night for a business seminar help at the hotel. This is a very nice hotel, well located about 1/2 mile for the SOL center and the museums. Located almost above the "Anton Martin" metro station. I have paid a little extra for a premium room - strongly recommended (the WIFI is free and the regular price is almost like the upgrade price). this room was a very modern, comfortable room. Staff is lovely and helpful. Breakfast - basic but good Spanish style breakfast. Tips: before you arrive join there MAS program (frequent traveler program), it is free and got some immediate benefits - late check out, cheap upgrade etc. I can recommend ti both for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BXtoNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tryp Atocha with a large group of 4 families. The location is in the heart of Madrid so it is close to everything. A car is not needed or recommended. While the neighborhood was not the prettiest, we felt comfortable there in a day or two. Just avoid McDonalds, Dunkin Donuts, and Burger King (all within 2 blocks). The family rooms, with bunk beds, were next to each other, which made it easy for the kids to visit each other. These rooms look out on a wall of the building next door so forget about a view. On the other hand, there are no stairs to climb or elevators to wait for. The staff was courteous and spoke English well enough to meet our needs. We tried our Spanish and they were appreciative of the effort. All in all, I highly recommend the Tryp Atocha.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - great breakfast - slightly noisy - but otherwise GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: ALeJune
Reviews.Content: The Tryp Atocha is in a great location; very central to most things you want to see in Madrid. My only complaints were that the room I was in faced the street so at night there was a bit of street noise that , and that the A/C did not work all that great. Luckily it was not terribly hot in Spain YET, so we can endure the temperature in the room by opening up the window in the bathroom to let some air in; however with that came the occasional smell of cigarette smoke, as people in Spain smoke everywhere. I was here on a week long holiday and did not spend much time in my room, so these things minor issues weren't anything I couldn't overcome. The room itself was nice and clean and the hotel staff were equally as great! As part of the hotel stay we paid for we had breakfast included every morning, which I have to give two thumbs up too! Or course it was your typical European continental breakfast, but in comparison to other breakfasts I've had included at other hotels, this far exceeded those! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, with just a warning concerning the street noise. If you do stay here, I would just request a room that doesn't face the street!!

Reviews.Title: “Alvin and the Chimpmunks”
Reviews.Author: marr
Reviews.Content: Real question is, is this hotel worth writing review? Probably not. Only good thing is location, right in the city centre with metro station exactly in front of the entrance. Everything else not worth to mention. Staff does not speak English at all (OK only one of them was speaking), breakfast is mediocre at the best with no hot tea water on second day and for rooms, well look at the photos and it will be clear for you. I understood that only family rooms were decorated in this theme nevertheless I was alone and they put me in family room no matter what. Room price was ok at 96 Euro breakfast included but if was going for leisure I would never stay here. One more thing, they explained to me that I have to buy internet cable due to non existence of wireless connection in the room. Well you guess there is wireless in the room (at least on the ground floor)

Reviews.Title: “A bit dissapointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Bruns
Reviews.Content: The good things first. You have a Metro station right outside the door and you are within walking distance of all the major turist attractions in madrid. The rooms and the hotel are clean, and even though the street outside is very busy you are not bothered by street noise. And the not so good stuff. The staff is not very friendly, the approach you like you are bothersome to them, further on their english was quite bad, not that mine is perfect (I am from Denmark, so english is not my native language), but I really had a hard time understanding them. The room are small, with quite hard beds. You have to pay extra if you want to use the internet. And then there is breakfast, if you like me are trying to eat healthy, you will have a hard time during breakfast most of the stuff they serve is filled with sugar or butter, which in my world is not the way to start the day, they had decent coffeee though. All together I would say you can get better value for money elsewhere in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “there are better options”
Reviews.Author: pmp007
Reviews.Content: small rooms with labirintic corridors, breakfast ok. Not a 4 star hotel, but rather a 3 star

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianeSpain
Reviews.Content: Asked for a quiet room and were allocated one in interior of hotel. Beautifully appointed, modern, spacious, comfortable, spotlessly clean. Reception staff excellent (in particular David Perez). First rate location for museums, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, and other attractions. Did not eat in hotel as good value breakfasts available locally. Metro stop "Anton Martin" directly outside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hopeless”
Reviews.Author: gerrydir
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in literally hundreds of hotels across the world. This place makes Fawlty Towers look like Claradiges

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location.”
Reviews.Author: andrep1
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel right by the metro station. Pricy breakfast, just drop by any of the 20 restaurant around for breakfast at 3rd of the price. Only issue we had was a stinky shower curtain that got changed when we asked...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for sightseeing in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: superman_lover
Reviews.Content: We stayed a tryp atocha from 12th June 09 until 15ht June 2009.The hotel staff were warm and friendly throughout and there is usually an english speaking person on rfeception at all times (which is rare for madrid). I agree with other reviews that the hotel feels more like a 3* than a 4* The room was functional with wooden floors, double bed, firdge, clean shower etc. It was a nice touch that when we asked the hotel where we could buy toothpaste they advised us that there were supplies in our room- cool. I guess the down side to the room was the view. Our window did not allow any sunlight, as we were facing a wall....oh well. anyway, the location was perfect- get off the metro at anton martin.

Reviews.Title: “Don't throw away your money”
Reviews.Author: natasha-neil
Reviews.Content: Good location but pricey.Not a good value for your money. Advertised as 4 star but more like a 3 star facility.Very basic accomodations in a location very close to the attractions.Literally steps away from the Metro. Helpful and knowledgable front desk staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: EugeneDuck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located if you are interested in going to the three major art museums in Madrid— all are within easy walking distance. And it is not much further to Plaza Major and Puerta del Sol. Although it is on a busy street and my room was in front, on the third (American) floor, what street noise there was did not bother me. My son who had a room, also in front, but down the hall, heard a siren once and party people only once in the course of our four day stay. My room was spacious as was the bathroom, nice closet. There is an extra charge for breakfast, but it was terrific (four kinds of meat, four kinds of cheese, fruit cup, pastries, rolls, eggs, etc.) The people at the front desk spoke English and were helpful. Also practically at the front door is an underground stop. And close to Athocha railroad station.

Reviews.Title: “avoid if you want a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: bermic
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first port of call of a 12 day coach tour of Northern Spain. We were staying here for 3 nights and arrived after a long day travelling from home to the airport ,then the flight ,and then the transfer to the hotel.Our room was overlooking the front of the hotel which is situated on a major road with traffic passing all through the night.Trying to sleep at night was a complete nightmare with the sound of car horns,sirens from emergency vehicles,and passing drunken people shouting,singing and whistling to each other. This went on all night until daybreak. A change of room was requested the following morning but with it being the weekend the hotel was full.The main reason for the noise is the poor quality double glazing in the rooms which does nothing to cut out outside noise and also the fact that nearly all the rooms are on the front of the hotel overlooking the road. So if you like a quiet nights sleep,give this one a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and Dim”
Reviews.Author: 500RoomNights
Reviews.Content: Okay, we booked the Tryp Atocha through Priceline, and having recently spent three years consulting in the hotel industry, I expected to get the worst rooms in the hotel. Even so, they advertise themselves as a 4-star property and responded to my bid on such. We were disappointed generally by the 4-star (as compared with Asia, North and South America) standard in Spain, but this was the worst. What we got for two rooms was very clean, but… Sol Melia obviously is trying to cut energy costs at the guest’s expense. Our very major complaint is that A/C is shut off from 3 am to 7 am daily – the front desk told us it is hotel policy. The staff was generally very nice, but I fault management. Even running “full blast” during the day, the A/C was not really comfortable (i.e., not properly maintained?), and we keep our home at 78 F during the hottest months. We were there in August, when the daily high was around 40 C, for crying out loud. Certainly not conducive to a good night’s sleep even in a very quiet room. Also, our rooms were “lit” by a total of 24 watts – 3 X 8 watt fluorescent bulbs in table lamps. So much for having a refuge from the heat of the city. Further, this allegedly 4-star property had absolutely no toiletry amenities in the bathroom. Soap at the sink was a squeeze bottle mounted on the wall with a broken fixture, such that it fell to the floor frequently. A request for repair brought no response. The shower's “combination shower gel/shampoo” (the same contents as the sink’s, I am sure) bottle at least stayed on the wall. Sol Melia’s apparent cost cutting efforts will and should alienate customers expecting a 4-star experience. We stayed at a Sol Melia in Granada also – an old property with deferred maintenance issues and not quite as clean, but at least they let the A/C run.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: NCcatpeople
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tryp Atocha is a wonderful little gem. The room, although small, is tastefully decorated and the marble in the bathroom is gorgeous! And there is a small close-up makeup mirror. The breakfast buffet has a good assortment of fruits, meats, breads and pastries. The front desk staff is pleasant and helpful and went out of their way to get me hot water for tea at night. Then there is the proximity to everything. Within walking distance to the Prado, tons of restaurants, subway and a pastry shop! We plan on returning to Madrid and will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nad8129
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights - it was within walking distance to many important attractions. The hotel was really very very clean, modern and well kept. So clean that the bathroom was inviting enough to have a bath in and soak after a tiring shopping day. Usually you would only trust your own bath at home for this. The beds all made up in pristine white linen! (contrasting with a previous hotel we were in in Andorra) The staff were very helpful, professional and could speak fluent English - which is a relief considering that most Spaniards dont. Our room gave onto a busy street but we still slept very well. Breakfast was better than average hotels in Mainland Europe - we had savory food, fruit and also loads of sweet items. I totally recommend this!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: pan_stam
Reviews.Content: The most remarkable advantages of the hotel are:- it is near a lot of places, museum and plazas, - near to a metro station, - and its very clean. On the other hand, i stayed in a room next to elevetor , so it was a little noisy, and at last some others travellers of the group charged them a lot, for the telephone calls that they make from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bilo61
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an 11 day independent tour of Spain and our first hotel was the Tryp Atocha in Madrid. We found the hotel to be conveniently located, walkable to the Plaza Mayor, Reina Sophia Museum, and the Atocha train station. The rooms were spacious, spotless, and had well-stocked mini-bars. The neighborhood is filled with wonderful small and inexpensive shops and many restaurants. The staff recommended one local place to eat that we found especially charming with excellent food--La Canada. Because our luggage was lost for 3 days, the five of us made liberal use of the neighborhood stores and hotel staff, who provided us with toothbrushes, hair combs, etc. and many helpful suggestions about where to purchase underwear and feminine hygeine products. The hotel has an odd layout--somewhat mazelike, with many small sets of steps between the elevators and rooms, so beware if you have difficulty walking. One of our rooms had a small balcony overlooking a picturesque side street. The only drawback being that trash collection was around 2am every day. The A/C was in excellent working order. Breakfast was included and left nothing to be desired--all the food was fresh and the variety was superb. I would definitely stay at the Tryp Atocha again. (The "sex club" across the street seems more of a peep show kind of place and was not offensive to us, but some may be disturbed by its proximity--we did note that there were no creepy individuals lurking in the area). All in all the Tryp is a well-located, clean, well-run hotel in a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly good!!”
Reviews.Author: shamz30
Reviews.Content: This hotel was actually not too bad. It had an old world feel to it and the location was minutes away from Prado and the Reina Sophia Museums, the Neptune and Cibeles fountains as well as the beautiful Botanical gardens. It is not in the best of neighbourhoods and as you arrive at the hotel and look around there are quite a few adult themed shops around it. However, you don't ever feel unsafe and the metro is so close that you can step out into it. Gran Villa station is only 3 stops away.. it is where all the major shopping is located. The rooms were clean and bathrooms were exceptionally clean. We had asked for a triple room and were a bit disappointed that we got a pull-out type camp bed as our third bed. They were not willing to move us into a different room with three proper beds and the view from the room was atrocious. It was of a shed and we hardly had any sunlight coming in... having said that.. we were happy and thankful that they changed our linen everyday, the linen was pristine and the breakfast was pretty good. The staff were very helpful and courteous. I I would definitely stay here again. It was quite peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all.”
Reviews.Author: hrhsan
Reviews.Content: TRYP ATOCHA is not a 5 star hotel , i do not know for sure what star hotel it is ! i had to stay in this hotel as a part of a tour package, here is the good and bad. THE GOOD Great location Anton Martin metro station is at the front door (really) prado , 10 minute walk, Grand post office , Cibelis fountain, botanical gardens , train station all within 5- 10 minute walk. Gran via, shopping , all within 10 - 20 minute walk. Front office helpful and speak English. very decent breakfast. Clean but small room. very nice bathroom marble and clean. Great pillows and clean beds. No smells during my visit. wood floors, quick help for in room problems(my AC was not working ) . decent common areas. Good Bidet!! THE BAD. At night a bit seedy, strip club or something like that near hotel but no seedy people hanging around. small rooms , ask for a nice view i had ground floor with view of drainage and someones back doors. concierge does not speak english. No porter service. dont expect much from the tv. small rooms , pull out bed is not good at all, it's like a camper bed. COMMENTS i would stay here again though, AC turned out to be good, Commercial size LUX hand soap pumps at sink and bath, you can ask for personal toiletries but Pump is fine as well. the location is unbeatable. so you can overlook the shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly rooms, No hot water”
Reviews.Author: Smartflyer
Reviews.Content: I am still confused what could possess someone to rank this hotel a 5 star. There is no in room internet (nor wifi in lobby), there are no individual toiletries (there is a big combination shampoo/bodywash bottle in the bathroom you share with future and former guests), no menu on TV, etc. etc. What makes this hotel unacceptable is the smelly rooms and the lack of hot water. I got to see 3 different rooms for myself and my party and all 3 smelled. Two smelled like smoke and the third like feces. The feces smell was arising from the drain in the shower. I can understand that some smokers may not notice the smell but for those of us who don't smoke it can be unbearable. The beds are OK though smelly but the bedding/pillows are about the level of an American 2 star hotel which is as I said OK. Location is good (which is the only thing you know about the hotel before getting stuck there). The shower did not have hot water by 1030 which was when I left for the airport (hotel said they worked on it the night before but did not offer anything else for not having a warm shower). I skipped it altogether though some in my party who took the cold shower were still shaking at the airport. Overall, I would have much rather paid more money so I could have slept in a room I could breath in and then taken a shower in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: trishfitzpatrickoc
Reviews.Content: First impressions arrived by metro which is outside the door which was a plus.The area was run down but felt safe and very close to the center. On arrival the receptionist gave no information about the hotel just simply gave us our room key and showed us where the lift was,which was a long way from the reception area. The bedroom was small and basic and there was an unpleasant smell coming from the bathroom. The hotel staff were ok could have been friendlier,asked one member of staff for cornflakes she showed me where they were picked them up and practically threw them at me, was quite upset at this. On a whole i would not recommend this hotel more like a two star hotel rather rhan a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “basic clean accommodation in an ok location”
Reviews.Author: absf
Reviews.Content: The room I was given faced the indoor courtyard, so there was very little light coming through the small window in the corner of the room. This made it somewhat dreary, but it was of sufficient size to move around, had a closet with a safe, mini-bar that you could put 1 or 2 of your own drinks in, and a desk where you could hookup your computer for internet access (available by the hour for a reasonable rate, or for the day for an unreasonable one). No wireless, though. TV was small, older and had bad reception, but who's there to watch TV? The bathroom had a tub, shower, toilet and bidet. It was well lit and sufficient size. Water pressure was good. Hotel provides only liquid soap and shampoo in big dispensers. (so you might want to bring your own). There's an entrance to the Anton Martin Metro station just a few meters from the hotel front door, so very convenient if you're using the Metro. Some familes with younger children may not like the peep show directly across the street, though. Despite this, the neighborhood felt safe and walkable. If you can get a good rate and are just looking for a place to sleep, this hotel will serve that purpose, but it's certainly not upscale, and probably only deserves a 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: zags40
Reviews.Content: When the taxi dropped us off I was exhausted and the Hotel looked like it was in a bad neighborhood. But after walking in and relaxing it was all good. The lobby and bar area is inviting with a large screen TV and a place to lounge, talk and have drinks. The staff are friendly and speak English. There are 2 computers for internet connections. The room was small but clean and had everything I needed. I am used to American hotels and this one suited me perfect. The breakfast was very good and had a wonderful variety. Our first day there we took a 1/2 day city tour which I highly recommend. Once we were outside of the hotel we realized how close we were to fabulous shopping, restaurants and sight seeing. We did alot of walking as we did not have a car (and are thankful for that..Madrid is no place to drive). I would highly recommend this hotel. The only downside is if you could not do a lot of walking. Also we didn't have kids..I think they would be bored silly as this is a walk and tour type area.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, excellent morning buffet. Centrally located, just up the street from the Prado. We were on the first floor near the lobby and found it a little noisy but would definately stay there again because of the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be decieved”
Reviews.Author: bebo52
Reviews.Content: I booked the Tryp Atocha because it is a Sol Melia hotel and I wanted to have the MaS membership advantage of having 2 breakfasts for the price of one. Also, I figured that if it was near Atocha train station it had to be pretty central to just about everything in Madrid. However, as we were driving up the street to get there we had a few misgivings because the closer we got to the hotel the more --- shops we saw. In fact, there was one across the street from the hotel. But when we checked in we inquired about this at the reception desk and the clerk assured us that this was not a red-light district. It was a Saturday night and sure enough when we left the hotel in search of a restaurant at around 8:30 p.m. we could see that the neighborhood was fine. The rooms were clean and modern and not too small. Our room was in the back of the hotel, which is a little bit of a hike-within-walls, but it had the advantage of being very quiet at night even though the hotel is on a busy street. The location couldn't be better. When you leave the hotel, there is a metro (Anton-Martin) directly across the street; turn left and you can walk to Paseo del Prado in 5 to 10 minutes; turn right and you can walk to Plaza Mayor in 5 to 10 minutes. I would definitely go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights and were pleased with our visit. While the Tryp Atocha entirely lacks character, the rooms are modern, brand new, spotless, silent and overall pretty posh. The location is central - you can easily walk to all of the major sights and many great restaurants nearby. The staff was basically invisible, unless you needed something, they were fast and helpful - exactly the way I like it. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best (by U.S. standards)”
Reviews.Author: MiamiAL
Reviews.Content: Visited Madrid during the Easter Week 2005, and had an enjoyable time there in Spain. The Tryp Atocha is rated as a 4 star hotel, but by U.S. standards I would put them at at high 3 star. The Tryp Atocha has an excellent location just steps from the Anton Martin subway station, which is the way my girlfirend and I took to and from the airport. It took 3 subway lines (about 3-4 stops each line) and an approxomate time of 45 mins. If you were to travel by taxi, with all the traffic problems in Madrid it could take longer and is more expensive at about 20 Euro. The Atocha Renfe station is a 5-10 minute walk if you want to go to other points in Spain (we went to El Escorial and Toledo from here)...The Hotel is 5-10 min walk to the Prado, Thysen and Reina Sofia museum in one direction, and 5-10 min walk to Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real and Puerta Del Sol, in other direction. Making the location of the Tryp Atocha excellent. The rooms are clean, but a bit small by U.S. standards, but I guess acceptable by European standards. Because it was unseasonable warm so early this year in Madrid, the hotel was hot, and they were not able to turn on the Air Conditioning yet. It appears they turn the Air Conditioning at some point in May. The Breakfast was diverse and quite good. The only real problem at the hotel was the lack of knoweledge by the front desk/concierge people. Many times we had questions for them, that they simply could not answer, for example, bull fighting schedule, times and best directions of the Renfe trains as well as bus schedules. Locations of post offices. Information regarding the Easter Week closings of certain sites and museuems. These bits of info would seem that concierges and hotel staff should know by simple virtue of being in the tourism business...But they often seemed disorganized and confused... Overall I would say that I would stay at this hotel again, if I could not find a better option. And I assume there are better options, as Madrid caters to a large tourism crowd.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tryp Atocha on sevral ocassions during the month of January 2005. It was my Madrid base during my trip to Spain. Very centrally located. Metro just right in front. A great place to stay if you are taking the AVE Train (@5 blocks down the street). Rooms very clean and comfortable. Twice I stayed in room 606, very quiet and very well ventilated. One time I stayed on the third floor with a room facing the street (Atocha). The room had double pane windows and I couldn't hardly heard any noice outside. It was good too. The staff was wonderful, very accomodating and professional. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MusicFanDublin
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on the hotel website for €90 per night including breakfast for 2 which was excellent and served until 11am. Room was fairly small and basic but clean. Good location 15 minutes walk from the centre and 10 minutes from the museums. Metro station outside the door (only 50 cent from the airport with a few changes). Nearest Metro station is Anton Martin not Atocha as you might think (which is a walk up a steep hill). Area is safe enough but as previous reviews mentioned, hotel is directly opposite two strip bars and on the Sunday night we stayed there, there were a lot of banging doors throughout the night and there was a konock on our door at 3am. Overall though, don't let this put you off as it might have been a one-off and the hotel represented good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Tryp Atocha. This was our 2nd stay at a Tryp hotel and we have enjoyed both. The hotel is new and the rooms had hardwood floors. The pillow selection feature was great! Location can't be beat with the underground stop just steps outside the hotel. Loads of restaurants, bars and sites close by. We were a bit nervous of the location based on the reviews we had previously read in Trip Advisor but as long as you aren't alone there is no issue. We also called the Somelia office and were able to get an even lower deal than the internet! I'd definitely stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Tryp Atocha
HotelInfo.Address: Atocha 83, 28012 Madrid, Spain
